meanings.definition: Relating to the study of ancient humans and their ancestors.
meanings.sent1: The paleoanthropological research team discovered a new fossil site.
meanings.sent2: Her paleoanthropological findings shed light on early human migration patterns.
meanings.sent3: The paleoanthropological conference was filled with exciting new discoveries.
meanings.sent4: His paleoanthropological expertise was crucial in identifying the ancient skull.
meanings.sent5: The paleoanthropological exhibit at the museum showcased our human history.

meanings.definition: Involving the scientific study of human evolution through fossils and artifacts.
meanings.sent1: The paleoanthropological evidence supported the theory of human evolution.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used paleoanthropological methods to analyze the ancient tools.
meanings.sent3: The paleoanthropological lab was abuzz with excitement over the new discovery.
meanings.sent4: She had a paleoanthropological approach to understanding early human societies.
meanings.sent5: The paleoanthropological expedition unearthed a treasure trove of ancient bones.
